top_categories.workout_context: Seven's Parallel singletrack, Pine plantation roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 78 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Seven's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
135ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Seven, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
10,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
10,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Seven. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Seven, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
78 miles on narrow parallel singletrack through pine burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on narrow parallel singletrack through pine. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Low-cadence force work for 10,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 10,500ft of climbing on narrow parallel singletrack through pine does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Seven’s 78 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Seven. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Seven demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: parallel singletrack, pine plantation roads, quartz gravel. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 78 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 78 miles of narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests in Nannup, Western Australia.
